comment: Very knowledgeable. Amazing slides! Tests are fair (cover information from class). Lectures are helpful and straightforward. He really knows how to deliver information in a clear and effective manner. Great teacher! Would absolutely take again! Offers review of tests during scheduled office hours.
Very cool! Drops two of each questions and two seminar attendance things, just show up and do the questions. You'll pass

Took for vertebrate zoology. Great professor. Grades are only labs and tests. If you do poorly on one, it is hard to get the grade back up. Great lectures, kinda funny. Chill class, attendance not mandatory, you don't have to talk. Go to class or miss out on good lectures. No extra credit. Great feedback. Wants you to succeed.

Pierson is a great professor. Tests, quizzes, and homework are all elementary. The key is paying attention in class since he likes to base all the test and quiz materials on the lectures and slides. The textbook is used for reference more than anything. He loves salamanders.

Super easy tests. Just rewatch the lectures/ppts. Only 4 out of 5 tests count (5th is a non-cumulative final). So i stopped going to class after the 4th test since I basically completed the course. Passionate about his salamanders.

Ok professor, has strict grading criteria on labs, no extra credit, he says you can turn in a lab report late and there will be little penalty, but in reality will take off many points if you turn an assignment in late.
Best Professor ever, always ready to listen and work with you. The exams are very straightforward. I would Definitely take him again for another class if I had the opportunity

I took Professor Pierson for Ecology lecture and lab. He’s amazing! His exams are based on the lectures so go to class or watch the recordings! He also cares a lot about his students and takes our mental health into consideration and he will work with you if you miss something because of it. Best professor I’ve had so far! 100% recommend!

Dr. Pierson's class is one of the more interesting ecology classes. He doesn't try to bore you with plant anatomy but instead curtails his class to be appealing for many premeds, he even pulls references to the human body and uses cute little salamander slides to explain concepts. If you want to learn ecology AND get an A, I would take him.
Hes a really nice guy and very passionate about what he does! Everything is covered in lecture and tests are very straightforward. Definitely one of the better professors Ive had.

I took him for Senior Seminar. the class itself is pretty easy and honestly super interesting. Lots of different speakers. YOU MUST SHOW UP TO LECTURES! online or off. He was so great. he gives you clear instructions on how to pass. Definitely recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria
